title: Physics Concepts as Indicative Framework to Preliminarly Model Systems of Economies
text:
Working Paper Draft  09 December 2025





1. Abstract
Economy - not pre-given by natural laws - is constructed as social set of co-living rules to allocate, distribute and share (natural and non-natural) resources. Ex-ante modelling economical systems by social rules (contractual, legislative, judicative, executive).




2. Introduction
The state (situation, position) of the Economy can be described by e.g. Assets, Liabilities, Expenses, Incomes, Profitability, Productivity, etc.. The Economy changes through time from a state \(r_0=\) “start” to a state \(r=\) “end”. For the state to change, work is applied by processing limited resources (e.g. access to raw materials and availability of intermediate goods), constrained capital (e.g. financial funds, interest rates, and inflation), as well as labor capacity (e.g machines and human force).
How can a state \(r\) be modelled by work \(W\), which is applied for the change to occure: \(r = \int A = \int \int W\) ?





3. Method, Elements, Scope & Approach
\(\exists\) Work done or received \(W \neq 0 \Rrightarrow \exists\) Change of State (“Displacement”, “Deformation”) \(r \neq 0\):
\[\begin{split} &
W = \partial A = \partial(E \cdot t) = \partial(p ⋅ r)
\end{split} \tag{1}\]
Geometrical: \[\begin{split} &
W = F \cdot r = mr \cdot a = I ⋅ \frac{v}{t} =  \frac{p}{t} ⋅ tv = Ft \cdot v =  pv = mv^2
\end{split} \tag{2}\]
Analytical: \[\begin{split} &
W = \mathcal{L} + \mathcal{H} = (\mathcal{K} - \mathcal{U}) + (\mathcal{K} + \mathcal{U}) = (\mathcal{K} - (\mathcal{V} + \mathcal{Z})) + (\mathcal{K} + \mathcal{U}) = (\mathcal{K} - \mathcal{U}) + E
\end{split} \tag{3}\]
Electro Magnetic: \[\begin{split} &
W =  \left( \frac{1}{2}mv^2 - q(\Phi - \vec{\mathcal{A}} \cdot \vec{v}) \right) + \left( \frac{1}{2} \frac{1}{m} (\vec{p} - q\vec{\mathcal{A}})^2 + q\Phi \right)\end{split} \tag{4}\]
Relativistic: \[\begin{split} &
W = \frac{v}{c} \sqrt{E^2 - (mc^2)^2}
\end{split} \tag{5}\]
Thermal: \[\begin{split} &
W = PV^{\iota} = T \cdot V^{\frac{f+2}{f}} = T \cdot V^{(\frac{c_P}{c_V}-1)} = T \cdot V^{\kappa-1} = T \cdot l \cdot g_0 = T \cdot n \cdot b_0 = T \cdot m \cdot c_0
\end{split} \tag{6}\]
Thermo Statistical: \[\begin{split} &
W = ΔY - ΔH = \Delta(T \cdot \Delta S - P \cdot \Delta V) - \Delta(T\cdot S)
\end{split} \tag{7}\]
Quantistic: \[\begin{split} &
W = ħ\mathcal{k} \cdot ω = ℎν\mathcal{k} = E\mathcal{k}
\end{split} \tag{8}\]





acronyms









\(A =\) Action
\(E = E_{kin} + E_{pot} =\) total Energy


\(t =\) time
\(r =\) space


\(v =\) velocity
\(c =\) light speed


\(p =\) momentum
\(F =\) Force


\(I =\) Inertia
\(\mathcal{L} =\) Lagrangian


\(\mathcal{H} =\) Hamiltonian
\(\mathcal{K} =\) kinetic Energy


\(\mathcal{U} =\) effective potential Energy (\(\in E_{pot}\))
\(\mathcal{V} =\) potential Energy (\(\in E_{pot}\))


\(\mathcal{Z} = \frac{1}{2}\frac{L_0^2}{mr^2} =\) Centrifugal Potential
\(V = r_1 \cdot r_2 \cdot r_3 =\) Volume


\(\mathcal{k} =\) Wave Vector (“curvature”)
\(W =\) Work (done vs. received)


\(P =\) Pressure
\(L_0 =\) angular momentum


\(T =\) endogen Temperature
\(H =\) exogen Heat


\(Y =\) endogen Energy (\(E_{kin} + E_{pot}\))
\(\Phi = \frac{\mathcal{V}}{q} =\) Electric Potential


\(\mathcal{A} =\) Magnetic Potential
\(b_0 =\) Boltzmann constant


\(g_0 =\) Gas constant
\(m =\) mass


\({\epsilon}_0 =\) electric constant
\({\mu}_0 =\) magnetic constant


\(\mathcal{E} =\) Electric Field
\(\mathcal{B} =\) Magnetic Field


\(n =\) amount of particles
H\(\mathcal{C} = m \cdot c_0 = \frac{\Delta H}{\Delta T}  =\) heat capacity


\(c_0 = \frac{1}{m}\frac{\Delta H}{\Delta T} =\) specific heat
\(S = b_0 \cdot \ln(\Omega) =\) Entropy (macro state)


\(l =\) Moll quantity
\(\Omega =\) micro states


\(z =\) amount of constraints (boundry conditions)
\(f = 3n \pm z =\) degrees of freedom


\(\kappa = \frac{c_P}{c_V} = \frac{f+2}{f} =\) adiabaty
\(\iota = \kappa\) ↔︎ adiabat


\(\iota = 0\) ↔︎ isobar
\(\iota = 1\) ↔︎ isotherm


\(\iota = \infty\) ↔︎ isochor
…







MACRO ECONOMY: GDP, Inflation, Import & Export, International Trade, Foreign Exchange, Money Quantity, Unemployment,
Goods Market (Production, Lager), Capital Market (Savings, Investments), Labor Market (Employment, Population Structure), Price vs. Value, Demand vs. Supply, Access to Resources, Trade & International Contracts
Supply:
\[\begin{split} &
E = C + S + T + M - X
\end{split} \tag{9}\]
\[\begin{split} &
E = W  + E_P + E_B + T_B + E_G - Z_G
\end{split} \tag{10}\]
Demand:
\[\begin{split} &
V_I = C + I + G + X - M
\end{split} \tag{11}\]
Equilibrium:
\[\begin{split} &
E = V_I       \\&
W - C = S = I        \\&
C + S = W        \\&
C + I = R
\end{split} \tag{12}\]
Domestic Production & International Trade:
\[\begin{split} &
V_S = E + T - B + D
\end{split} \tag{13}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_S = V_I + E_M - E_X
\end{split} \tag{14}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_N = V_S - D
\end{split} \tag{15}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_N = E + T - B
\end{split} \tag{16}\]
Productivity & Monetary Value:
\[\begin{split} &
P \cdot V_I = U \cdot Q
\end{split} \tag{17}\]



Conjecture of Equation 17 and Equation 6


acronyms








\(C =\) Consumption of Private Households


$ =$ …


\(M =\) Import of Goods and Services


\(X =\) Export of Goods and Services


$ =$ …


\(D =\) Depreciations (Reinvestments)


\(Q =\) Money Quantity


\(V_I =\) Gross Domestic Product GDP = \(\frac{Output}{Input}\), Tradevolume


\(W =\) Wages (Salaries, …)


\(E_B =\) Income of priv. Business (Companies, Services, Real Estate Rentals, Thesaurated Gains)


$ =$ …


\(T_B =\) Tax on Capital of Comapies (Business Assets)


\(Z_G =\) Interests on Governmental Debt


\(V_S =\) Gross National Produkt, Society GNP


\(I =\) Investments on Assets, incl. Storage Change


\(E_X\) Capital Earnings and Wages to Abroad


…







MICRO ECONOMY: Supply, Demand, Equilibrium, Pricing, Elasticity, Utiliy, Production & Cost, Labor, Aggregates …
How individuals and companies make decisions to allocate scarce resources.
\[\begin{split} &
A = Property Capital       \\&
= Liq. + Deb. + G\&A + Stock + Mob. + Immob. + Intel.Prop.       \\&
L = Financial Capital = Cred. + Bondemissions + Equity       \\&
X = Expenses = Costs + Depreciations       \\&
I = Pricevalue $\cot$ Salesquantiy + Profit       \\&
Y = I - X = Profit      \\&
S = \frac{Credits + Bondemissions}{Equity}       \\&
D = ...       \\&
C = ...       \\&
E = ...       \\&
Q = Cash + shortterm Capital       \\&
G = ...       \\&
E_T = ...       \\&
E_D = ...       \\&
U = \frac{Output}{Input}        \\&
P = \frac{Gain}{Input}       \\&
R_E = \frac{Earning}{Equity}       \\&
R_I = \frac{Earning}{Investment}        \\&
R_A = \frac{Earning}{Capital}        \\&
F = ...       \\&
F_F = CF - Depreciations - Amortisations       \\&
W = ...       \\&
V = ...       \\&
B = ...       \\&
N = Liquidity + Debits - Credits       \\&
\end{split} \tag{18}\]


acronyms









\(A =\) Assets (Vermögen)
\(L =\) Liabilities


\(X =\) Expenses
\(S =\) Financial Leverage (Verschuldungsgrad)


\(I =\) Income
\(E =\) Equity


\(Y =\) Yield, Gain, Return, Earning, Profit
\(Q =\) Liquidity


\(D =\) Debit
\(C =\) Credits


\(G =\) G&A General & Administration
\(E_T =\) EBIT


\(E_D =\) EBITDA
\(U =\) Productitivy


\(P =\) Profitability
\(R_E =\) ROE


\(R_A =\) ROA
\(R_I =\) ROI


\(F =\) Cash Flow (CF)
\(F_F =\) Free CF


\(W =\) WACC
\(V =\) NPV


\(B =\) DB Deckungsbeitrag
\(N =\) NUV (Nettoumlaufsvermögen)


$ =$ …
$ =$ …




test: Equation 4





4. Hypothesis & Conjecture
How consistently map economical measures to the quantities of nature to model the economical system?




Economy


Physics




Assets
Resources

Matter


Liabilities
Capital

Space


Expenses
Labor
Work
Momentum


Income

Energy
Time








5. Concept & Model





6. Analysis & Synthesis
…




7. Conclusion & Follow-up
…

2. Cockshott WP (2011) Classical Econophysics. Routledge Advances in Experimental; Computable Economics


3. Wladyslaw W (2013) Macroeconometric Models, 1st ed. Springer


4. Lichtenegger K (2015) Schlüsselkonzepte zur Physik, 1st ed. Springer Spektrum


5. Padmanabhan T (2015) Sleeping Beauties in Theoretical Physics, 1st ed. Springer


6. Carter M (2001) Foundations of Mathematical Economics. The MIT Press


7. Michaelides PG (2025) 21 Equations that Shaped the World Economy, 1st ed. Palgrave Macmillan Cham


8. Pires da Cruz J (2025) Introduction to the Physics of the Economy and Finance, 1st ed. Springer Cham


9. Cass D, Shell K (2014) The Hamiltonian Approach to Dynamic Economics, 1st ed. Elsevier, Academic Press


10. Haven E, Khrennikov AI, Robinson T (2017) Quantum Methods in Social Science - A First Course. World Scientific, Publishing Europe Ltd

title: Physica
text:
\(\exists\) Work done or received \(W \neq 0 \Rrightarrow \exists\) Change of State (“Displacement”, “Deformation”) \(r \neq 0\):
\[\begin{split} &
W = \partial A = \partial(E \cdot t) = \partial(p ⋅ r)
\end{split} \tag{1}\]
Geometrical: \[\begin{split} &
W = F \cdot r = mr \cdot a = I ⋅ \frac{v}{t} =  \frac{p}{t} ⋅ tv = Ft \cdot v =  pv = mv^2
\end{split} \tag{2}\]
Analytical: \[\begin{split} &
W = \mathcal{L} + \mathcal{H} = (\mathcal{K} - \mathcal{U}) + (\mathcal{K} + \mathcal{U}) = (\mathcal{K} - (\mathcal{V} + \mathcal{Z})) + (\mathcal{K} + \mathcal{U}) = (\mathcal{K} - \mathcal{U}) + E
\end{split} \tag{3}\]
Electro Magnetic: \[\begin{split} &
W =  \left( \frac{1}{2}mv^2 - q(\Phi - \vec{\mathcal{A}} \cdot \vec{v}) \right) + \left( \frac{1}{2} \frac{1}{m} (\vec{p} - q\vec{\mathcal{A}})^2 + q\Phi \right)\end{split} \tag{4}\]
Relativistic: \[\begin{split} &

\end{split} \tag{5}\]
Thermal: \[\begin{split} &
W = PV^{\iota} = T \cdot V^{\frac{f+2}{f}} = T \cdot V^{(\frac{c_P}{c_V}-1)} = T \cdot V^{\kappa-1} = T \cdot l \cdot g_0 = T \cdot n \cdot b_0 = T \cdot m \cdot c_0

\end{split} \tag{7}\]

\end{split} \tag{8}\]

title: Physica
text:
MACRO ECONOMY: GDP, Inflation, Import & Export, International Trade, Foreign Exchange, Money Quantity, Unemployment,
Goods Market (Production, Lager), Capital Market (Savings, Investments), Labor Market (Employment, Population Structure), Price vs. Value, Demand vs. Supply, Access to Resources, Trade & International Contracts
Supply:
\[\begin{split} &
E = C + S + T + M - X
\end{split} \tag{1}\]
\[\begin{split} &
E = W  + E_P + E_B + T_B + E_G - Z_G
\end{split} \tag{2}\]
Demand:
\[\begin{split} &
V_I = C + I + G + X - M
\end{split} \tag{3}\]
Equilibrium:
\[\begin{split} &
E = V_I       \\&
W - C = S = I        \\&
C + S = W        \\&
C + I = R
\end{split} \tag{4}\]
Domestic Production & International Trade:
\[\begin{split} &
V_S = E + T - B + D
\end{split} \tag{5}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_S = V_I + E_M - E_X
\end{split} \tag{6}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_N = V_S - D
\end{split} \tag{7}\]
\[\begin{split} &
V_N = E + T - B
\end{split} \tag{8}\]
Productivity & Monetary Value:
\[\begin{split} &
P \cdot V_I = U \cdot Q
\end{split} \tag{9}\]



Conjecture of Equation 9 and ?@eq-workthermal

title: Physica
text:
MICRO ECONOMY: Supply, Demand, Equilibrium, Pricing, Elasticity, Utiliy, Production & Cost, Labor, Aggregates …
How individuals and companies make decisions to allocate scarce resources.
\[\begin{split} &
A = Property Capital       \\&
= Liq. + Deb. + G\&A + Stock + Mob. + Immob. + Intel.Prop.       \\&
L = Financial Capital = Cred. + Bondemissions + Equity       \\&
X = Expenses = Costs + Depreciations       \\&
I = Pricevalue $\cot$ Salesquantiy + Profit       \\&
Y = I - X = Profit      \\&
S = \frac{Credits + Bondemissions}{Equity}       \\&
D = ...       \\&
C = ...       \\&
E = ...       \\&
Q = Cash + shortterm Capital       \\&
G = ...       \\&
E_T = ...       \\&
E_D = ...       \\&
U = \frac{Output}{Input}        \\&
P = \frac{Gain}{Input}       \\&
R_E = \frac{Earning}{Equity}       \\&
R_I = \frac{Earning}{Investment}        \\&
R_A = \frac{Earning}{Capital}        \\&
F = ...       \\&
F_F = CF - Depreciations - Amortisations       \\&
W = ...       \\&
V = ...       \\&
B = ...       \\&
N = Liquidity + Debits - Credits       \\&
\end{split} \tag{1}\]


acronyms









\(A =\) Assets (Vermögen)
\(L =\) Liabilities


\(X =\) Expenses
\(S =\) Financial Leverage (Verschuldungsgrad)


\(I =\) Income
\(E =\) Equity


\(Y =\) Yield, Gain, Return, Earning, Profit
\(Q =\) Liquidity


\(D =\) Debit
\(C =\) Credits


\(G =\) G&A General & Administration
\(E_T =\) EBIT


\(E_D =\) EBITDA
\(U =\) Productitivy


\(P =\) Profitability
\(R_E =\) ROE


\(R_A =\) ROA
\(R_I =\) ROI


\(F =\) Cash Flow (CF)
\(F_F =\) Free CF


\(W =\) WACC
\(V =\) NPV


\(B =\) DB Deckungsbeitrag
\(N =\) NUV (Nettoumlaufsvermögen)


$ =$ …
$ =$ …
